qas.question: Other than Somali, what is an official language of Somalia?
To what language family does Arabic belong?
In what neighboring country is Arabic also an official language?
What organization do both Djibouti and Somalia belong to?
For how long has Somalia had connections to the Arab world?

context: In addition to Somali, <a0_0>Arabic<a0_0/>, which is also an <a1_0>Afro-Asiatic<a1_0/> tongue, is an official national language in both Somalia and <a2_0>Djibouti<a2_0/>. Many Somalis speak it due to <a4_0>centuries<a4_0/>-old ties with the Arab world, the far-reaching influence of the Arabic media, and religious education. Somalia and Djibouti are also both members of <a3_0>the Arab League<a3_0/>.
